title: Bitatlım: Hyperlocal Marketplace & Logistics Platform
summary: A multi-tenant marketplace for perishable goods delivery in Istanbul, featuring a hybrid logistics engine and automated financial splitting.

problem.description: Managing the logistics of perishable desserts while handling complex multi-party financial transactions in real-time.

your_contributions: Architected a custom Linux VPS infrastructure using Nginx and PM2, reducing hosting costs by 90% vs. managed cloud.
Engineered the 'Veroz' hybrid logistics module, allowing dynamic switching between Seller-Fulfillment and Platform-Fulfillment.
Implemented a cryptographic ledger for automated revenue splitting (Platform Fee, Seller Net, Courier Payout).
Developed custom VS Code tooling (extensions) to standardize developer workflows.

results.evaluation: Successfully deployed to production with zero-downtime updates using manual artifact strategies.

engineering_decisions.reason: Critical need for long-running WebSocket connections (order tracking) and strict cost control.
To decouple order logic from fulfillment logic, enabling 'Veroz' fleet integration without rewriting core order flows.
Avoids 'it works on my machine' errors by shipping pre-built binaries (Next/Nest) rather than building on production.

limitations: Manual scaling required for sudden traffic spikes (vertical scaling only)
Address validation relies on external APIs (Mapbox/Radar) subject to rate limits
future_work: ML-based Dietary Health Recommendation Engine (Sugar/Fat analysis)

Concurrent delivery assignments to multiple couriers
Live notifications across web and mobile

Clients: Unpredictable delivery times, no tracking, fragmented handoff

title: Defining the Landscape of Pathogenic Features
summary: A deep learning framework to predict bacterial pathogenicity and virulence factors directly from protein sequences using molecular evolution signatures.

problem.description: Predicting the 'danger' of emerging or uncharacterized bacterial proteins where traditional homology-based methods (BLAST) fail due to low sequence similarity.
constraints: Taxonomic bias (over-representation of specific families like Mycobacteriaceae)
Memory-intensive feature space (8,900+ dimensions) within 12GB RAM limits
Risk of data leakage via taxonomic memorization

system_overview.output: Binary Pathogenicity (Human Pathogen) + 14-class Virulence Factor Classification (VFC)

components: 1D Convolutional Neural Network (Conv1D) for motif detection
Self-Attention mechanism for capturing long-range residues
Gradient-based XAI (SHAP) for biological feature auditing

your_contributions: Developed a memory-efficient k-mer encoding pipeline for 8,928-dimensional feature space
Implemented a Conv1D + Attention model in PyTorch for hierarchical feature extraction
Conducted model auditing using SHAP to ensure learning from biological motifs rather than taxonomic labels
Resolved critical memory and dimension errors in the XAI pipeline for sparse genomic data
Engineered a multi-label classification system for 14 distinct Virulence Factor categories

results.evaluation: Validated using SHAP GradientExplainer to confirm focus on pathogenic motifs vs. taxonomic bias.

engineering_decisions.reason: Solves variable-length sequence issues and provides fixed-width input for high-dimensional efficiency.
Prevents data leakage where the model 'memorizes' genus names rather than learning universal biological signatures.
Significantly reduced memory footprint for high-dimensional (8k+) sequence data.

limitations: Retraining required for significant shifts in microbial pangenomes
Potential for false negatives in extremely rare or novel virulence mechanisms
future_work: Expanding to environmental metagenomic risk assessment

short_card.tagline: Sequence-based DL for virulence factor classification and pathogenicity prediction

title: Multivariate Air Quality Forecasting with NeuralForecast
summary: Thesis project on multivariate time-series forecasting of air pollutants (PM10, NO2, SO2, O3) using NeuralForecast deep learning models with rich meteorological and temporal features.

problem.description: Forecasting multiple air pollutants several days ahead using heterogeneous meteorological and temporal signals under non-stationary and noisy conditions.
constraints: Limited robustness of classical statistical models

system_overview.input: Historical pollutant concentrations, weather variables, temporal encodings, lagged and rolling features

components: Feature engineering (lags, rolling windows, calendar features)

your_contributions: Formulated the forecasting problem and experimental setup
Designed multivariate feature engineering strategy (54 features)
Implemented NeuralForecast models for multi-horizon prediction
Handled non-stationarity and temporal splits correctly
Evaluated deep models against classical and recurrent baselines
Documented methodology and results as a bachelor thesis

results.evaluation: Rolling-origin evaluation comparing NeuralForecast models against ARIMA and LSTM baselines on held-out temporal splits

engineering_decisions.decision: Use NeuralForecast instead of custom model training
engineering_decisions.reason: Provides optimized, research-backed implementations for multi-horizon deep time-series forecasting

engineering_decisions.decision: Multivariate forecasting instead of independent univariate models
engineering_decisions.reason: Captures cross-pollutant dependencies and shared temporal dynamics

limitations: Performance degradation during extreme or unseen weather patterns
Retraining required to adapt to long-term distribution shifts
Deterministic forecasts without uncertainty estimates
future_work: Probabilistic forecasting using quantile or distributional outputs
Concept drift detection and adaptive retraining
Extension to spatial or graph-based air quality modeling

short_card.title: Air Quality Forecasting (Thesis)
short_card.tagline: 7-day multivariate air pollutant forecasting with deep time-series models

title: Vehicle Detection & License Plate Recognition Pipeline
summary: End-to-end computer vision system for vehicle detection and automatic license plate recognition using YOLO, RCNN, and OCR models.

problem.description: Automatically detecting vehicles and extracting license plate text from images under varying lighting, angles, and noise conditions.
constraints: High precision required for OCR accuracy

system_overview.output: Vehicle bounding boxes, license plate localization, and extracted plate text

your_contributions: Designed the full end-to-end vehicle and license plate recognition pipeline
Implemented YOLO and RCNN models for vehicle detection
Integrated multiple OCR engines for license plate text extraction
Built modular data loading, feature extraction, and evaluation code
Evaluated models using mAP, IoU, Precision, Recall, and F1-score
Organized a clean, extensible project structure suitable for research or production

results.evaluation: Evaluated detection models using standard object detection metrics and OCR accuracy on held-out test images

engineering_decisions.reason: Balance between real-time performance (YOLO) and detection robustness (RCNN)
Improve robustness of text extraction across different plate qualities

limitations: Performance degrades on extremely low-resolution or heavily occluded plates
Inference optimized for images rather than video streams
OCR accuracy sensitive to plate angle and motion blur
